content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Find the ArXiv Blog on the ArXiv website and summarize the content of its latest article.  Please interact with https://arxiv.org/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The task is to find the ArXiv Blog on the ArXiv website and summarize the content of its latest article. There is no direct link to a "Blog" visible on this part of the homepage. To proceed, I need to look for a menu or link related to "Blog," which might be further down the page or in another section. I should scroll down to see if there is a blog section or link.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current visible portion of the page lists various subject categories (Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science) with no reference or link to a "Blog." To find the ArXiv Blog, I need to continue scrolling further down the homepage to look for any blog section or link.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screen still only shows lists of categories in various fields (Quantitative Biology, Quantitative Finance, Statistics, Electrical Engineering, Economics), but no indication of a "Blog" section or link. The homepage may have more content further down, so I should keep scrolling to check for a footer or additional sections where a "Blog" link or reference might appear.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "About arXiv" section is now visible, listing links such as "General information," "How to Submit to arXiv," "Membership & Giving," and "Who We Are," but there is no visible mention of a "Blog." However, the bottom is often where organizations link to blogs or external platforms, and there may be more if I scroll just a bit further.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.85
Completion: 0.25
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The page appears to have reached the footer, displaying links for "About arXiv," "Help," "Contact," "Subscribe," and policies, but still no mention of a "Blog." The homepage and footer do not provide a link to a blog, so it may be located in the "General information" or "About" section. The "General information" link [28] is likely to contain a site overview or may link to the blog.
Action: Click [28]
Confidence: 0.85
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "About arXiv" page is displayed, with a sidebar menu including "News" [5]. "Blog" is not explicitly visible, but "News" is the most likely section related to blog updates or articles on most institutional sites.
Action: Click [5]
Confidence: 0.92
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "arXiv Blog" link [9] is now visible under the "News" section. This is the direct way to reach the ArXiv Blog and access its latest article for summarization.
Action: Click [9]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.6

content:
Thought: The latest article on the ArXiv Blog is titled "Attention Authors: Upcoming Scheduled Maintenance to arxiv.org," published on September 16, 2025. The visible summary says the arXiv database will be down for scheduled maintenance on September 17th, 2025, with details about the downtime. To provide a full summary, I should click "CONTINUE READING" [9] to access the complete content.
Action: Click [9]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.7

content:
Thought: The full content of the latest ArXiv Blog article is now visible. It explains that arXiv.org will undergo scheduled maintenance on September 17th, 2025, from 7AM to 9AM EDT. During this window, users will not be able to log in or submit, edit, or endorse papers, though browsing and searching will remain possible. The update is expected to take two hours, and users are directed to arxiv.org's status page for timely updates.
Action: ANSWER; The latest article on the ArXiv Blog, titled "Attention Authors: Upcoming Scheduled Maintenance to arxiv.org" (September 16, 2025), announces a scheduled maintenance outage on September 17th, 2025, from 7AM to 9AM EDT. During this time, users will not be able to log in or submit papers, and all login-required functions will be disabled. Browsing and searching will still be possible. The outage is to upgrade servers and is expected to last two hours. Updates will be provided via https://status.arxiv.org.
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 1.0

During this time, users will not be able to log in or submit papers, and all login-required functions will be disabled. Browsing and searching will still be possible. The outage is to upgrade servers and is expected to last two hours. Updates will be provided via https://status.arxiv.org
